Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center, near St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall. It offers clean, basic rooms and a complimentary breakfast, but lacks the amenities of a typical chain hotel.

414 Hotel is a small, intimate haven near Restaurant Row with a charming leafy patio, mosaic tables, and bedrooms featuring photographic cityscapes, white down comforters, and natural fiber sheets. The hotel has a European vibe, and guests can have breakfast together at a long, attractively stained table brightened by flowers.
60 Thompson is a modern, stylish boutique hotel located in SoHo with a cool lobby bar and rooftop bar. The hotel is known for its friendly staff and convenient location near shops and restaurants.

6 Columbus is a modern, chic boutique hotel with a trendy atmosphere and a Japanese-inspired restaurant, located near Central Park and the Columbus Circle subway stop. The hotel features stylish rooms with contemporary minimalist design, flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and Kiehl's or Fresh bath products.
This boutique hotel has a modern and stylish decor, a small lobby, and offers a wine reception in the evenings. The rooms are cozy with warm lighting and comfortable beds.

The Ace Hotel has a hipster vibe with a lively lobby scene, library table, and bar; some rooms include features like guitars and record players. The hotel has funky decor with reclaimed furniture and accessories, and a masculine style with dark lighting.

The Affinia 50 is a smaller, modern hotel with a lounge area on the second floor, pod coffee machines, and orchids in the lobby; it offers free wine and cheese on some evenings. The rooms are executive suites, with options for a lounge, bedroom, kitchen, and bathroom.
The Affinia Dumont is a stylish hotel with modern decor, large rooms, and a good location in the Murray Hill neighborhood. Although a smaller hotel, the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Affinia Gardens, located on the Upper East Side, offers spacious rooms with kitchens and a "tranquility" theme, including a tea bar. The hotel is described as having a zen-like philosophy and spa-esque atmosphere, appealing to those seeking a relaxing environment.
The Affinia Manhattan is located across from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden with a grand lobby and bar. The rooms feature kitchens and are clean, with pillow menus and updated bedding.
The Affinia Shelburne is a recently renovated hotel with modern decor, a chic lobby, and a groovy bar/restaurant with a popular local following. It also features a rooftop bar with great city views.

AKA United Nations offers modern, well-equipped apartments with kitchens and comfortable living spaces, featuring modern decor and a generally quiet atmosphere, with complimentary breakfast on weekdays.

The Algonquin Hotel has an old New York feel with a classic boutique style, art deco character, and a lively lobby, but doesn't have a hip scene. The hotel is historic and elegant, with art deco character, New Yorker cartoon wallpaper, and a resident cat.

The Americana Inn is a basic, clean budget hotel in midtown Manhattan, offering small rooms with shared bathrooms, TV, and a sink. Some rooms have been recently painted and include LCD TVs, and the hotel is secured with a buzzer entry system.
Amsterdam Court Hotel is a small, modern, and clean hotel with a snappy little lobby and a trendy cocktail bar. Rooms feature a contemporary brown and beige color scheme and modern design.

The Astor on the Park is a basic, clean, and European-style hotel with small rooms, friendly multilingual staff, and is located across from Central Park and near the subway. It is a great base for exploring the city and is frequented mainly by European guests.

The Bedford Hotel is described as a comfy-style boutique hotel with a relaxed atmosphere and accommodating staff. The lobby is nicely decorated, and some rooms are spacious suites with sitting rooms and kitchenettes.

The Beekman Tower has an Art Deco design with spacious rooms that include kitchenettes and living areas, but some guests have noted that the decor is outdated. The hotel has a restaurant/bar on the top floor that provides great city views.

The Hotel Belleclaire is a stylish, modern hotel with sleek rooms in a renovated historic building on the Upper West Side, near Central Park, with hardwood floors, flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and optional shared bathrooms. Some rooms have views of Broadway, and the hotel is close to shops, restaurants, and subway stations.

The Bentley Hotel has a modern, clean, and boutique-like design, with a rooftop bar that has great views of the city, but some found the hallways and elevators to be dark. It is located on the upper east side, a bit off the beaten path, in a quiet area near the East River.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is a new, modern hotel with clean rooms, hardwood floors, and flat-screen TVs, located in Chinatown and close to Little Italy, SoHo, and the subway. Some rooms have heated bathroom floors and large windows, and the hotel provides free Wi-Fi and continental breakfast.

The Best Western Convention Center Hotel is described as a basic but clean hotel with new furnishings, and modern bathrooms. Some reviewers mention a "boutique" feeling and that the hotel is filled with European travelers.

The Best Western Hospitality House is an apartment-style hotel with spacious rooms, full kitchens, and a location in midtown Manhattan, near the Waldorf Astoria. Some rooms feature hardwood floors and are described as tastefully decorated and having a contemporary/retro feel.

The Seaport Inn is a small, charming hotel with tasteful decor, offering a cozy and quiet atmosphere in the South Street Seaport area. Some rooms have views of the Brooklyn Bridge and terraces, and the hotel features prints of historic etchings of the neighborhood.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a renovated tenement building with artistic decor, offering uniquely decorated, spacious rooms with a vintage Americana flavor and a cozy atmosphere. Select rooms include balconies and views of the city.

Broadway Plaza Hotel is described as recently renovated with a boutique style, though some found it basic and office-like with a small lobby. The rooms are large for NYC, clean, and have marble tile floors instead of carpet.
The Buckingham Hotel has a small, artsy lobby with a music theme. Rooms are apartment-style with kitchens and hardwood floors, some renovated with modern bathrooms.

The Candlewood Suites Times Square offers small studio suites with mini-kitchens and cozy decor, featuring amenities like full-sized refrigerators, free laundry, and a workout room. The hotel is new, clean, and located within walking distance of Times Square.

The Carlton Arms is an artsy, budget-friendly hotel where each room is uniquely decorated by different New York artists, offering a funky and adventurous experience. It's located in a safe midtown area near subways, restaurants, and bars, with a lobby featuring a resident cat.

The Carvi Hotel is a new, small, and comfortable hotel with clean rooms, marble bathrooms, and flat-screen TVs. It is located conveniently near subway lines, with a Starbucks and CVS nearby, and the building was previously owned by Madonna and renovated from a school.

The Casablanca is a small boutique hotel with a North African-inspired decor and a relaxed lounge with complimentary drinks and snacks, reminiscent of a B&B. The atmosphere is cozy, with a haven to relax in after a busy day.

Chambers Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with industrial-chic decor, art pieces, and unique design details like drawing paper and color pencils. Rooms have french windows and the hotel offers a relaxed but sophisticated atmosphere.

Chelsea Lodge is a budget-friendly hotel with a charming, eclectic decor, a cozy, home-like atmosphere, and a location in the quiet, safe Chelsea neighborhood near the subway and various shops and restaurants. Rooms are small, but very clean, with some offering garden views and New England-style decor.
Chelsea Pines Inn has movie-themed decor, including vintage posters, and offers a relaxed atmosphere with a courtyard. It is located in Chelsea, near the Meatpacking District and Greenwich Village.

The Chelsea Savoy is a basic, no-frills budget hotel with small but clean rooms, and is located in the Chelsea neighborhood close to subway lines and restaurants. Some rooms have been updated with new carpets and marble vanities, and the hotel offers complimentary coffee and pastries in the lobby.

City Club Hotel is a small, intimate, and stylish boutique hotel with a modern decor, frequented for its central Midtown location and DB Moderne restaurant. Rooms feature dark, masculine decor, Hermes bath products, and technology such as TV's hidden behind mirrors.

The Solita Soho is a small, modern, and clean boutique hotel in lower Manhattan, situated at the edge of Soho and close to Little Italy and Chinatown. Some rooms have flat-screen TVs and views of the Empire State Building.
The hotel has modern, clean rooms and a small, stylish lobby lounge with free computers. Rooms feature IKEA-like modern furnishings, flat-screen TVs, and are described as professional.

Club Quarters Midtown is a clean, modern, and efficient hotel with small rooms, catering to business travelers with amenities like free WiFi, work desks, and community computers. The hotel has a relaxed but stylish lounge area and a no-frills, self-service approach.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center has a sleek, European modern style and a clean, crisp atmosphere appealing to those seeking a discreet and private experience. The Terrace Club on the 7th floor offers a relaxing space with comfortable seating, a fireplace, and a terrace with views, along with free internet access.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea has a recently renovated, safe, and friendly environment, with marble in the lobby and a beautifully-restored, tin ceiling. There is also a bar owned by Nick and his partner along with Patricia.
The hotel features a classic-looking restaurant, stain-glass windows in the reception/bar area, and a spiraling staircase. Reviewers describe it as older, a bit dated, but with character.
The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is a new and clean hotel with nicely appointed rooms, comfortable beds, and modern bathrooms. The rooms are decorated in a modern style with a divine shower head.
This hotel has been recently remodeled with a classy old-world feel downstairs and comfortable, contemporary rooms. The hotel offers a fitness center, free internet, and a free continental breakfast.

The hotel has modern decor, new rooms, and a lobby with a flatscreen TV and free computer/printer. Rooms include flatscreen TVs, coffee makers, ironing boards, and individually controlled AC/heat; bathrooms have granite sink tops and showerheads with multiple spray settings.

The Comfort Inn offers clean, newly renovated, and modern rooms, some with city views from higher floors. It provides a simple, adequate stay with free high-speed internet and flat-screen TVs, appealing to those seeking value over luxury.
The Comfort Inn Times Square has modern and new rooms with flat-screen TVs and iPod docks. The rooms are small, but decorated in a mod style with marble and tile baths.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, design-focused hotel with a library-like lobby and a hip vibe. The hotel has a bar area and is located in the East Village, close to restaurants, bars, and subway lines.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is a clean and comfortable budget hotel in the Tribeca area, next to a subway station, with small, recently remodeled rooms. It has unpretentious decor, free internet, and is near restaurants, cafes, and shops.
This hotel offers a clean and modern experience, and is described as a business hotel without much character. Its rooms feature flat-screen TVs, and there is complimentary coffee in the lobby.
The Courtyard Upper East Side has a clean, modern lobby with plasma TVs, stylish decor, and a glass wall overlooking the indoor pool. Rooms are furnished in a spare, modern style.

The Courtyard Marriott Fifth Avenue offers modern and clean rooms, some with recent renovations, though they tend to be small. The hotel is described as having a boutique-style atmosphere without the glitter.

The Courtyard Midtown East has clean, spacious rooms and a convenient location, with the subway close by, making it easy to get around the city. Some rooms have great views, and nearby restaurants and shops provide convenient options for dining and necessities.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo and features individually designed rooms, art-filled public spaces, and a bar with a wide selection of wines. The hotel attracts a wonderful crowd and offers a relaxed atmosphere.
The Crowne Plaza Times Square has a stylish lobby with a trendy bar. The rooms are modern and have comfortable beds.

The Da Vinci is a small, European-style hotel with marble and cherry wood decor in the lobby, offering a cozy atmosphere with a gas fireplace and a restaurant/bar downstairs. Rooms have flat-screen TVs and some offer street views.

The Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square offers spacious suites with amenities like a wet bar, microwave, and refrigerator, with some rooms offering impressive city views. While not particularly hip or trendy, the hotel is clean, well-appointed, and conveniently located.
The Doubletree Chelsea is a modern hotel with new amenities. It is known for its friendly and helpful staff and is located within walking distance of many attractions.

The Doubletree Metropolitan has a retro, modern, and funky decor with a lively bar, and a newly remodeled lobby. Some reviewers found the rooms to be stylish, clean and with a decent size for NYC, with comfortable beds and a large HDTV.
This modern and stylish hotel has a trendy, hip atmosphere with a cool lobby bar and roof bar and blue lighting. Rooms have a minimalist design, Bose radios, and flat-screen TVs.

The Duane Street Hotel is a small, modern, and stylish boutique hotel located in the Tribeca area of NYC, with clean and well-designed rooms. It has a cozy lobby and restaurant area, and offers services like evening turndown with sweet treats.

The Dylan Hotel is a small, modern boutique hotel with a convenient midtown location near Grand Central Terminal. It features stylish decor with chemistry-themed touches and a comfortable, quiet atmosphere.

The Eastgate Tower is known for its spacious, apartment-style suites with kitchens, offering a quiet and convenient location in midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station. Though the decor is often described as dated, the hotel is praised for its cleanliness and friendly staff.

I am sorry, but I cannot fulfill this request. I cannot determine if the hotel has a "laid-back but stylish atmosphere" based on the reviews provided. The reviews focus primarily on the hotel's location, cleanliness, size of rooms, and value.

The Embassy Suites offers spacious suites with modern decor, free breakfast, and evening drinks in a location removed from the Times Square crowds. It's situated in Battery Park, next to the Hudson River, with views of the water and New Jersey.

The Empire Hotel features a trendy and hip decor, a comfortable lounge area with comfy seating, and a rooftop bar that is fun and lively. It is located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and Lincoln Center.
The Envoy Club offers spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, with decor described as stylish, though some find it dated. Guests can enjoy a rooftop deck with city views.
The hotel has a stylish, boutique feel with modern, large rooms and furniture and is located in the Financial District. The lobby lounge has a laid-back atmosphere with rap music.

The Excelsior Hotel is an older, European-style hotel with mahogany and marble decor in the lobby, a library-style breakfast room, and clean rooms. The hotel's location on the Upper West Side is residential and near Central Park, museums, restaurants, and transportation.
The Fairfield Inn has a modern decor with warm burgundy and beige colors and cool-looking bathrooms with glass shower doors. The breakfast room is uniquely decorated.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is a smaller, European-style hotel with stylishly decorated rooms, a library, and an Irish pub and courtyard. Many reviewers describe the hotel as a warm, intimate, and quiet respite from the city.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is a smaller, intimate hotel with an Irish touch, offering comfortable and updated rooms. Its bar and restaurant are described as warm and friendly, providing a relaxed atmosphere.
The Flatotel has a sleek and modern lobby with a bar, and offers spacious rooms with minimalist decor. Some rooms have kitchens and jacuzzis.

The Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea offers a modern, stylish decor with a hip atmosphere, and some rooms have views of the Empire State Building. The lobby sometimes plays techno music and has a bar, though some found the music to be loud.

The Four Points Soho is a new, modern hotel with clean, functional rooms and wood and steel accents. It has a small, cozy bar and is located in an up-and-coming area near restaurants and shops in Soho and the West Village.

The Four Points Times Square is a new and clean hotel with modern, minimalist decor, and comfortable beds. Rooms include amenities like a flat-screen TV, iPod docking station, and free internet, but are small, as is typical for NYC.

The hotel has a sleek, modern design with a lobby that feels like a calm, cozy coffee shop, and features a swanky bar. The crowd is mostly corporate, and the hotel is centrally located near shopping and Central Park.

Gild Hall has a modern, cozy style with a British club meets Zen simplicity decor, quirky touches like rhino footrests, and antler chandeliers. The hotel features leather sofas, plaid throws, and rooms with comfortable beds and Kiehl's toiletries.

The Gramercy Park Hotel features eclectic, dark, bohemian decor and artwork with a hip bar and a rooftop bar that has a relaxed atmosphere. It is located in a quiet residential neighborhood and has access to Gramercy Park.

The Grand Hyatt has a grand lobby with plants and a large water feature and has some tastefully and stylishly refurbished rooms. The Commodore Lounge is a comfortable and sophisticated place to hang out.
The Greenwich Hotel features a European-style decor, a cozy courtyard, and a drawing room. Rooms include complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages, with a warm and comfortable feel.

The Hampton Inn is a new, clean, and modern hotel with flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds; it is located near the subway, Macy's, and the Empire State Building. Some reviewers note stylish or modern decor and furnishings.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden has a modern, clean, and sleek style, with flat-screen TVs and minimalist chic lobbies. The hotel provides complimentary tea, coffee, and cookies in the lobby, creating a relaxed atmosphere.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea is described as a modern, clean, and well-maintained hotel with stylish decor, and good service; it's located in the Chelsea area, a quieter part of Manhattan that offers a more humanly-scaled ambiance. Reviews suggest it provides a comfortable and convenient base for exploring New York City, with easy access to subway lines and various attractions.

The Hampton Inn Soho features modern decor with art-photography, a greenhouse, and exposed beams in the lobby, aiming for an industrial-chic feel. It is located on the edge of SoHo, near trendy shops and art galleries, with subway access nearby.
The hotel is described as small and modern, with clean rooms and bathrooms, but lacking a bathtub in some rooms. It is a narrow, tall building with only six rooms per floor.

The Hampton Inn Seaport is described as a small, modern hotel with stylishly decorated, immaculately clean rooms and comfortable beds, offering a boutique look with deep-blue walls in some rooms. Some rooms feature balconies with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and South Street Seaport, and flat-screen TVs are included.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with large rooms that include amenities like a refrigerator, TV, and a safe. It is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of major attractions.

The Hilton Club is located within the Hilton on the 37th and 38th floors and offers a smaller, more personal hotel experience in a central Manhattan location near Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Rooms are newly decorated with a "ship-like" design that makes good use of space.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is described as a modern, clean, and stylish "boutique" hotel with well-maintained rooms and a small, tranquil lobby. It has contemporary room decor, ergonomic chairs, and offers city views from higher floors.
The Hilton Garden Inn is a new, clean, and modern hotel with HD TVs, free Wi-Fi, and ergonomic chairs in the rooms. The hotel has a small bar and lounge area and is located next to a subway station.
The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square has modern, well-equipped rooms featuring black and white photos of NYC. It is described as clean, nicely sized for NYC, and more 4-star than 3-star.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca is described as a new and clean hotel with a contemporary feel and a laid-back atmosphere, situated in a less touristy area convenient to Soho, Tribeca, and the subway. Rooms feature comfortable beds, microwaves, refrigerators, and free internet, with additional amenities like a gym and business center.

I am sorry, but the reviews for this hotel do not contain information about hotels with a laid-back but stylish atmosphere. The hotel does have some stylish areas, such as lobby bar and rooms. The decor is generally described as modern, but the overall atmosphere of the hotel is busy.

The Hilton Times Square is described as almost like a boutique hotel, much smaller, quieter, and more relaxed than New York Hilton, with modern rooms that have writing desks. It's surprisingly hip and funky for a Hilton, with somewhat contemporary furnishings and nice art.

The Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue offers modern, clean rooms with premium touches like in-room coffee makers, heavy wooden hangers, and comfortable beds with soft linens. It is located in midtown Manhattan, close to shopping, restaurants and many attractions.

The Holiday Inn Express Times Square South is a new or recently renovated hotel with modern, clean rooms and abstract designs, including widescreen TVs and good bathrooms. It's located a few blocks from Times Square and has free internet and breakfast.

The Holiday Inn Express Madison Square Garden is a new, modern hotel with clean rooms, a garden terrace, and a business center. It is located close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and Times Square.
The Holiday Inn is in lower Manhattan near Chinatown and Little Italy with the Canal Street subway stop nearby. Reviewers describe it as clean and serviceable, but not luxurious or stylish.

The Holiday Inn Midtown has spacious rooms, is located in a quiet area near Central Park and Columbus Circle, and features a rooftop pool; the lobby has been renovated, but some rooms are dated. The hotel is frequented by tourists, tour groups, and Europeans.

This modern, recently renovated hotel is located in the Chelsea/Garment district, within walking distance of several subway lines. The hotel is clean and has a friendly staff, but rooms are small and elevators can be slow.

Hotel 17 has a funky, stylish, and European-style vibe with dark wood trim, quirky decor, and mismatched wallpaper, located in the safe and walkable East Village near Union Square. Some rooms have a sink, but bathrooms are mostly shared and cleaned regularly.

Hotel 31 is a budget-friendly hotel with clean, small rooms and shared bathrooms, located in a central Manhattan location near the Empire State Building and subway lines. The hotel has an old-fashioned style with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building, and is popular with European travelers.
Hotel 373 is a modern and trendy boutique hotel with small, clean rooms and comfortable beds. It is located in midtown Manhattan near the Empire State Building and has a Starbucks attached.

Hotel 41 is a trendy, small boutique hotel with modern decor and a stylish bar, offering a comfy bar and a nice vibe, with plasma TVs. There is a nightly happy hour and it's furnished with white fluffy robes.

Hotel 99 is a new hotel with modern, well-decorated rooms that include a large LCD TV. The hotel was still under construction at the time of these reviews, with some rooms still being completed and the elevator not yet operational.

The Beacon Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, near Central Park, shops, and restaurants, and close to the subway; the rooms are large and well-maintained, some newly renovated in an Art Deco style with spacious suites and kitchenettes. The hotel is described as having a boutique feel.

The Hotel Chandler is a stylish boutique hotel with modern decor, Frette linens, Aveda toiletries, a small gym and a bar; it is near the Empire State Building in a quiet midtown location. Rooms are small, but the staff is friendly and attentive.

Hotel Deauville is a European-style hotel with an old-world feel, featuring antique elevators operated by staff, and some rooms have purple bathrooms. The hotel has basic, clean rooms and is centrally located.

The East Houston Hotel is a small, modern hotel with an Asian minimalist decor, cherry wood floors, and a rooftop terrace with city views. It has a laid-back and unpretentious atmosphere, with a stylish design and helpful staff.

Hotel Elysee is a smaller boutique hotel with a French-inspired atmosphere, featuring a Club Room with complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese. It is located in Midtown East, close to many attractions, and has a Monkey Bar.
Hotel Gansevoort is located in the Meatpacking District and has a trendy, modern style. It features a rooftop pool and bar with great views.

Hotel Giraffe is a small boutique hotel with a relaxing atmosphere, offering a wine and cheese reception in the evenings and newspapers in the lobby. It has rooms decorated with subdued modern decor, and a rooftop lounge.

Hotel Grand Union offers a clean and comfortable stay with rooms that are small, but equipped with a TV, fridge, and air conditioning. The hotel is in Midtown Manhattan, close to the Empire State Building and public transportation.

Hotel Indigo has a modern, minimalist interior design with spacious rooms relative to other NYC hotels, featuring comfortable beds and Aveda toiletries. The bar and restaurant have an attractive, cool atmosphere.
Hotel Mela is a chic boutique hotel in the heart of midtown Manhattan with a modern sitting room and flat-screen TVs. The hotel is stylish with a contemporary decor and a small lobby.

The Hotel Metro is an art deco style hotel with a lobby decorated with film posters and a rooftop bar. The hotel has a contemporary feel, a library area for connecting with others, and a rooftop terrace with Empire State Building views.

Hotel Newton provides clean and well-designed rooms with remodeled bathrooms, some offering views of an interior courtyard for a quiet experience, and a lobby with a clean and sharp look. The hotel reminds guests of medium-sized, non-chain hotels in Britain and Northern Europe.

The Hotel on Rivington features floor-to-ceiling windows with great views, a sleek and modern design, and a hip vibe in the Lower East Side. It has a bar/restaurant that is popular at night and comfortable bedrooms on the upper floors.

Hotel Reserve is a modern, clean, and well-designed hotel with a small, unassuming lobby, located in a converted office building. Rooms feature Ikea-style furniture, comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and upscale bathroom amenities.

The St. James Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and offers clean, basic rooms, but it is an older hotel with thin walls and can be noisy, particularly in rooms facing the street. Renovations have been ongoing, with some rooms updated, but travelers recommend requesting renovated rooms on higher floors away from the street noise.

The Stanford Hotel is a budget-friendly option near Koreatown with renovated rooms and a clean, art-deco-style lobby, though some find the decor dated. It offers basic amenities like free internet and continental breakfast, but note that there may be limited natural light in some rooms.

Hotel Wales is a quaint, European-style hotel with old-world decor, a rooftop terrace, and a comfortable lounge on the 2nd floor. It is located on the Upper East Side, close to Central Park and museums.
The Hudson Hotel is a trendy hotel with a Phillip Stark design, exposed brick, and ivy on the walls. It has a library bar, outdoor bar, and nightclub.

Ink48 is a new, modern hotel with stylish decor, spacious rooms, and large bathrooms, located on the west side of Manhattan, about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel offers city or Hudson River views and a complimentary breakfast and wine reception, with friendly and helpful staff.

Inn New York City is a brownstone inn on the Upper West Side with four suites, each uniquely decorated with antiques and a mix of art deco, French, Edwardian, and 1950s floral chic styles. The inn is located on a quiet street a block from the subway and a few blocks from Central Park, offering a mix of city access and a neighborhood feel.

The Barclay Intercontinental is an older, traditionally-styled hotel with a grand lobby and old-fashioned ambience, with a bar that has a European feel. The hotel has an elegant, polished, quiet feel to it.

The Essex House is described as having an art deco lobby, a modern style, tasteful decor, dim lighting and streamlined, technology driven rooms. The hotel bar is also described as lively and interesting.

The Kitano Hotel is known for its clean, quiet, and tranquil atmosphere with Japanese-inspired decor, offering an oasis of calm in midtown Manhattan; some rooms have views of the Empire State Building or Chrysler Building. It features a jazz bar and Japanese restaurant, with some reviewers noting the hotel's serene environment.
The La Quinta Manhattan features a rooftop bar with Empire State Building views. Rooms have flat-screen TVs and iPod-ready alarm clocks, and a "business center" offers free internet and printing.

The Lafayette House is a quirky boutique hotel in a great downtown location with uniquely decorated rooms featuring antique furniture and sitting areas, some including kitchenettes, fireplaces, and courtyard access. It offers a more private, less full-service experience, appealing to independent travelers who appreciate a unique, historic setting.
Le Parker Meridien is a modern hotel with a notable, stylish lobby and French brasserie-style bar. The hotel also has cartoons in the elevator and a hidden burger joint in the lobby.

The Library Hotel is a small, stylish boutique hotel with a library theme, rooftop garden, and reading room, that offers a welcoming and intimate atmosphere. The lobby is tastefully decorated, and the rooftop bar has a sleek feel.

The Loews Regency is described as having a classy, old-school atmosphere with a pleasant and cozy lobby and nicely preserved historical touches in the public spaces, plus a mellow adjacent nightclub with jazz crooners/piano bar. Rooms feature Jonathan Adler pottery and a minimalist decor.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side, known for its quiet and luxurious atmosphere, spacious rooms with kitchenettes, and marble bathrooms. It is located in a residential neighborhood near Central Park and high-end shopping, offering a more private and less touristy experience.

The Mandarin Oriental has a modern, Asian-influenced design with a sophisticated minimalist approach and touches like lotus flowers. It has stylish rooms and a tranquil, relaxed atmosphere with a lobby lounge that has amazing views of the park and city.

This hotel is noted for its convenient location near Times Square and Broadway theaters, though many reviewers describe the rooms as small and in need of renovation. However, some guests appreciated the hotel's vintage charm and its easy accessibility to city attractions.

The Millenium Hilton has clean, spacious rooms decorated in a contemporary style, with large LCD TVs; the hotel has a small lobby bar and a pool and fitness center, with some reviewers noting the hotel is primarily aimed at business travelers. Some reviewers note it is a quiet hotel.

The Millennium Broadway is located close to Times Square, offering modern rooms and views of the Chrysler and Empire State buildings. However, the hotel also receives feedback that it is gloomy and the rooms are dated, worn and occasionally unclean.
The Millennium UN Plaza offers spacious rooms with fantastic views and clean, modern decor. Note that the gym and pool are good, but the hotel is not located near the tourist mobs of midtown.

The Moderne Hotel is a small, retro-styled hotel with Andy Warhol-themed decor, offering a library, internet cafe, and coffee bar, but no full restaurant. Some guests describe the hotel as funky, minimalist, and stylish.

Morgans is a modern, trendy hotel with a black and white theme throughout, providing a stylish sanctuary in the city. It has a small lobby and a living room on the 4th floor where guests can relax and enjoy complimentary tea and coffee.

Murray Hill East Suites is not the most modern hotel, with some reviewers noting dated decor, but it has spacious rooms and kitchenettes, with neoighborhood like settings. Some reviewers note Japanese art that matched the bed spread.

Murray Hill Inn is a clean, no-frills hotel with European style, small rooms, and remodeled bathrooms, situated in a quiet but central location with good access to shops, restaurants, and transportation. The hotel has a basic, clean interior with wooden floors, new bathrooms, and some rooms have flat-screen TVs.

The hotel features a cocktail bar, rooms with flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks.
The property is modern, clean, and has excellent gym facilities.

The hotel has an old-world charm and is housed in a historic building, but has been renovated with new bedding, flat-screen TVs, and granite bathrooms. The lobby has a nice look but can get busy, and there is a lively bar/lounge area.

The Marriott Marquis is a large hotel with a gym and a lobby bar that has great views of Time Square. It has many modern amenities, multiple restaurants, and a revolving restaurant/bar on the top floor.

The New York Palace is described as having a classy feel, grand interiors, and a sweeping staircase, with a mix of business people and tourists creating a comfortable atmosphere. The hotel is not pretentious or snooty, but is grand and elegant with friendly and relaxed staff.

The Night Hotel is a trendy boutique hotel with a black and white color scheme, low lighting, and cool music playing in the hallways, located close to Times Square. It has a small bar area and lounge, as well as personalized business cards for guests.

The Novotel Times Square has a beautiful lobby with an outdoor terrace and great views of Times Square, a nice bar, and a lobby gaming area for kids. The hotel has a European feeling and draws an international crowd of French and German guests.
Off Soho Suites offers apartment-like suites with kitchenettes, located within walking distance of Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown. The rooms are described as clean and decorated in a posh style.

The Omni Berkshire Place has a comfortable and stylish lobby bar, and is located in Midtown near shops, museums, and transportation. Some found the atmosphere cozy and relaxed, though some found it gloomy and outdated.

On the Ave is a modern, clean hotel with stylish rooms, a rooftop terrace, and a convenient Upper West Side location near the subway and Central Park. The hotel provides a very urban boutique feel, and offers deluxe and panoramic rooms with comfortable beds.

Park 79 is described as clean, and tidy with a recent renovation attempting to blend colonial style with modern updates; however, some found the rooms to be small and a bit shabby. Some reviews note charming interiors and excellent locations with a great price.

The Park Central Hotel has a nice and trendy lobby, as well as a stylish stone facade at the entrance and offers old looking exterior with an updated lobby and bar that has a nice atmosphere. Some reviewers describe it as modern and posh.

The Park South Hotel has a stylish, art deco design with a happening bar/restaurant, live jazz on weekends, and a lobby decorated with leather couches and fresh flowers. Rooms are smaller, but clean and tastefully decorated, with flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds.

The Peninsula is described as lovely and old school opulent without being garish, renovated with quietly sexy rooms, with public areas that feel intimate rather than awe-inspiring and more like a private club than a hotel. The rooms are renovated with quietly sexy rooms and while the lobby areas are elegant, they are a little bit dim due to the dark wood and olive green carpeting, and the feel is intimate rather than awe-inspiring.

The Phillips Club offers stylish, modern studio, one, and two-bedroom suites with kitchens, flat-screen TVs, and Bose sound systems. The lobby is stunning, and the location is near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle.

The Plaza Athenee is an intimate, European-style boutique hotel with a residential feel, located on a quiet, tree-lined street on the Upper East Side, close to Central Park and Madison Avenue. It features a cozy bar, a small restaurant, and rooms with comfortable beds, though some rooms are noted as small and dated.

The Radisson Martinique, formerly the Holiday Inn Broadway, is an older property with a small, often crowded lobby, and small rooms that are clean and tidy. The hotel features renaissance staircase and has a shop in the lobby.

The Ramada Eastside offers clean, recently remodeled rooms with flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds, with some rooms offering views of the Chrysler or Empire State Buildings. It's located in the Murray Hill area, close to the subway and various restaurants, and is noted for being a good value option in Manhattan.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is a clean and well-maintained budget hotel with a newly renovated look, and modern furnishings including flat-screen TVs and iPod docks, and offers a basic but adequate complimentary continental breakfast. The hotel has a bar/lounge and is centrally located near the Empire State Building and Penn Station.

Renaissance 57 is a modern, recently renovated boutique hotel with a European feel, a sleek decor, warm lighting and artistic glass. The hotel has a bar/restaurant that is a hot spot, and a new lounge for hotel guests.

The Renaissance Times Square is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with a unique lobby decor and a trendy, clean atmosphere. It has comfortable beds and offers a quiet respite from the hustle and bustle of its central Times Square location.

The Residence Inn Times Square offers spacious, clean rooms with granite kitchens and comfortable beds, with a bar/lounge on the 3rd floor that has a pool table and entertainment, offering a cozy retreat. The hotel is located near Bryant Park, providing a slightly quieter location than Times Square.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park offers a quiet location at the tip of Manhattan, near Battery Park, with harbor views and spacious rooms. It has a corporate/business feel, with stylish decor, though some find it a bit far from the hustle and bustle of midtown.
The hotel is modern and clean with stylish decor, featuring amenities like flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds. It has a small, boutique-hotel feel with self-service check-in kiosks.

The Roger Smith Hotel is a boutique hotel with unique, homey rooms featuring art, books, and comfortable beds, and it has a friendly and helpful staff. It is centrally located near Grand Central and other midtown attractions, with Lily's restaurant and bar offering good food and a pleasant atmosphere.

The Roger Williams Hotel is a trendy boutique hotel with modern, colorful decor, recently renovated, and provides a relaxing, "homey" atmosphere with a chic lobby, and was described as being like staying at someone's home rather than a hotel. It's located in a quiet area, away from the Times Square crowds, but within walking distance of many attractions.

Room Mate Grace is a trendy and hip hotel with a lively pool/bar area that features DJs and parties, and is known for its dim lighting and European style. It has a great central location near Times Square with compact but well-designed rooms.

The Royalton Hotel has a hip and trendy atmosphere with a dark and moody ambiance, offering a unique experience with a popular lobby bar. The hotel is known for its modern design, comfortable rooms, and convenient location near Times Square and Fifth Avenue.
This hotel has an old charm and is described as having an older style decor. It is not contemporary or modern, but some past guests found it stylish.

The San Carlos Hotel has a quiet and relaxed atmosphere with spacious, clean rooms, luxurious bedding and bathrobes, and Aveda bath products. The hotel is decorated in a modern, clean, and homey atmosphere and features a serene lobby and a business center/lounge area with computers.

Seafarers International House is a budget-friendly option located near Union Square, offering basic, clean rooms with options for shared or private bathrooms. It provides amenities like free internet access, and is close to shops, restaurants, and public transportation.

The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers has a glitzy lobby, a lobby bar with atmosphere, and a club floor bar that is nicer for a quiet drink. There is also a contemporary internet lounge/bar/coffee and seating area in the lobby.

The Skyline Hotel has an art deco style lobby and a bar with a relaxed atmosphere; the rooms are spacious, with options for deluxe rooms and suites that include a king bed, pullout sofa, and city views. The hotel also features an indoor pool with city views and is near many casual and reasonably priced restaurants in Hell's Kitchen.

The Smyth Tribeca is a new, modern hotel with stylish, minimalist design, cozy nooks, and a hip atmosphere. Rooms feature comfortable beds with high-quality linens, marble bathrooms, and trendy decor.
The Sofitel New York is described as chic and quiet with a luxurious, but understated, art-deco lobby. The bar has a French feel and comfortable lounges/chairs and the gym is well-appointed.

The Soho Grand Hotel is located in the heart of the SoHo shopping district and has a hip lobby and bar area with a stylish, modern, and industrial-chic decor. Some rooms have city views, and perks include a free coffee bar on each floor, a pet goldfish upon request, and a cool bar/lounge.

Soho House New York is a trendy hotel with spacious, individually decorated rooms featuring vintage and modern furniture. It has a rooftop pool and bar with great views, and is located in the Meatpacking District near shops, restaurants, and clubs.

The Stay Hotel has a trendy and modern lobby with funky lighting and fish tanks, plus a bar/restaurant (Aspen Social Club) that turns into a lively nightclub on weekends. The rooms are small, but clean and stylishly decorated, with amenities like flat-screen TVs and Bose sound systems.
The Alex Hotel has a modern and elegant design with minimalist decor, described as having a contemporary flair and "swanky" feel. It is a boutique hotel that aims for a sleek and soothing experience.
The Belvedere Hotel has an art deco-style lobby and renovated Executive rooms.  Some rooms include a small kitchenette, as well as microwaves and refrigerators.

The Benjamin is located in midtown NYC and has a small boutique feel, with stylish rooms that are equipped with a small kitchen; some rooms have balconies. The hotel exudes a friendly atmosphere and is known for its excellent service.

The Blakely is a smaller boutique hotel with dark wood features, rooms with kitchenettes and flat-screen TVs. The hotel is known for being clean, quiet, and having comfortable beds, with a location close to Central Park and Times Square.

The Bowery Hotel has a laid-back atmosphere, vintage decor with a British old-world design, and a popular bar/lounge that attracts locals. The hotel is located in a trendy downtown neighborhood, within walking distance to shops, bars and restaurants.

This trendy, modern hotel features rooms with hardwood floors and Molton Brown toiletries, a stylish lobby with dark colors and house music, and a Cellar Bar. It is located across from Bryant Park and near Times Square.

The Carlton on Madison is a stylish hotel with grand and atmospheric lobbies, recently renovated rooms, and is located near the Empire State and Flatiron buildings. The hotel has a mix of modern and expected New York decor and is close to bars.
The Carlyle has a classy, old-school, and understated elegance with art deco and 1940s-inspired decor. It has a lobby with black marble floors and features like a supper club and jazz shows.

The Franklin Hotel is a small, European-style boutique hotel on the Upper East Side with clean, well-appointed rooms featuring chandeliers and cashmere throws. It offers a complimentary continental breakfast, an evening wine and cheese reception, and a 24/7 coffee bar.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments offers a stylish and comfortable stay with chic decor, well-appointed rooms, and comfortable beds; it is located on Restaurant Row, near Times Square. The hotel has a New Orleans-themed bar and restaurant and offers a continental breakfast.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is a modern, clean hotel with a European feel and stylish decor, including spotlit orchids, that some guests found charming and artsy. It is located in Chelsea, near restaurants and the subway.
The Gem Hotel is described as having a "Zen minimalism" and "stylish" modern decor with black and white color schemes and splashes of red. Rooms feature flat-screen TVs and bathrobes.
The Gem Hotel is a small, modern hotel with stylish, compact rooms, iPod docks, and flat-screen TVs. It is located on the edge of SoHo, close to the Lower East Side, Little Italy, and Chinatown.

The Grant Hotel is a budget-friendly option near the subway, with clean but basic rooms that include a TV with cable. Some rooms have been renovated, but the shared bathrooms may require a wait and might not always be clean.
The Hampton Inn has a modern, recently renovated lobby with comfy sofas and a small gift shop. The rooms are spacious by NYC standards with comfortable beds, plasma TVs, and granite countertops.

The Helmsley Carlton House Hotel offers spacious rooms, some newly refurbished with sitting areas and kitchenettes. It is located one block from Central Park on the upper east side, with shopping and restaurants nearby.

The Helmsley Park Lane has a good location across from Central Park and is described as having a boutique style. Some past guests describe it as elegant, old-fashioned, and "vintage," while others found the decor outdated and gaudy.

The Herald Square Hotel is a budget-friendly hotel centrally located near the Empire State Building with renovated rooms that include flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds; rooms can be small and some decor can be old-fashioned. There is a free coffee machine in the lobby and some rooms feature art-gallery-style walls.

Hotel 91 is a modern, minimalist hotel located in the heart of Chinatown, with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and flat-screen TVs. The hotel provides free tea and coffee in a lounge and is near the subway, making it convenient for exploring the city.

The Hotel at Times Square is a modern, newly renovated hotel with stylishly decorated rooms, flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and a contemporary-style foyer. It has a small bar on the 2nd floor and is known for being clean, quiet, and comfortable.
The Inn at Irving Place is located in two combined brownstones with antique furnishings, aiming for a simple and old-fashioned atmosphere. It features a tea salon and a bar in the basement.

The Iroquois is a beautifully decorated and elegant boutique hotel with a sophisticated but not pretentious lobby, a cozy library, and a romantic atmosphere. It has a classy, calm, good-looking appearance with friendly and helpful staff, offering an intimate and European-type ambiance.
The Jane Hotel has a retro, quirky, and vintage vibe with small, cabin-like rooms reminiscent of a ship. It is located in a convenient area near the Meatpacking District and West Village.

The Kimberly Hotel is a classic NYC hotel, with some rooms recently updated with antique-looking furniture and marble bathrooms, but some guests describe the decor as dated. Some rooms feature balconies, kitchenettes, and comfortable beds with Italian linens.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel with individually decorated, spacious rooms that are regularly updated with high-end, custom designs. It is known for being quiet, with professional staff and a convenient location near restaurants, shops, and the subway.
The London NYC is described as a stylish, modern hotel with spacious rooms and a lively bar, offering a combination of luxury and comfort. It has a hip vibe and contemporary design.

The Lucerne is a traditionally decorated hotel with elegant rooms, a great location on the Upper West Side, and is near many restaurants and bars. The hotel has a quiet, clean, and homey atmosphere with exceptionally polite and pleasant staff.

The Manhattan Club offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes and comfortable beds, with a lounge on the 26th floor. The decor is functional and mid-level, not particularly luxurious, but clean and more than adequate.

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, classic boutique hotel with a gentleman's club atmosphere, marble floors, a library with a fireplace, and a cozy bar/restaurant. The hotel offers a laid-back atmosphere with stylish rooms, Aveda toiletries, and a 24-hour complimentary coffee bar.

The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with funky decor and stylishly designed rooms. It has a hip and minimalist lobby, with details like a fireplace, and offers a rooftop terrace.
The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme, small but well-designed rooms, and a lobby with a retro look. It features a lively bar, restaurants, and is located in the Chelsea/Meatpacking District.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. The hotel rooms feature modern design with universal remote control, electric shades, large LCD TV, and marble bathrooms.

The Marmara Manhattan is an apartment-style hotel on the Upper East Side with spacious, clean suites featuring full kitchens and modern decor. Guests appreciate its residential neighborhood feel, proximity to grocery stores and restaurants, and easy access to subway lines for exploring the city.

The MAve is a modern, clean hotel with a vibrant lobby, red and white decor, and stylish rooms featuring hardwood floors. It's located in the Flatiron district, close to Madison Square Park, with easy access to subway lines.

The Mercer is a chic, understated boutique hotel with a relaxed vibe and a lobby that feels like a comfortable living room; only hotel residents can drink or eat in the lobby bar, ensuring there's always a place to sit. The hotel's style is minimalist with soothing, subtle palettes, and there are no gimmicks or glitz.

The Michelangelo Hotel is a smaller, luxury boutique hotel with an Italian-style decor, a beautiful lobby with classical music, spacious rooms, and a location convenient to Times Square and Broadway. The hotel offers a calm atmosphere, comfortable beds, and complimentary coffee in the lobby.
The Milburn Hotel, located on the Upper West Side, has a newly refurbished lobby with a library. The hotel's rooms are spacious and provide free access to Wi-Fi.

The Muse Hotel is a trendy, modern, and clean boutique hotel with an art deco theme, located a short walk from Times Square. It features a glamorous bar, wine hour, and modern bathrooms stocked with AVEDA products.
The New York Helmsley features an old New York, swanky, dimly lit lobby with a bar. The rooms are standard but well-appointed, with comfortable beds and marbled bathrooms.
The New Yorker Hotel has an Art Deco style and some renovated rooms. Rooms include amenities such as HD TVs and free WiFi.

The Pierre is described as a classic, old-world style hotel with traditional decor, but it was renovated in 2009 to have a contemporary feel in the rooms. The hotel has touches like elevator operators and a lobby lounge with a cocktail menu.

Some guests found the Plaza's decor to be over-the-top and not classy, comparing it to a Las Vegas aesthetic, while others describe the hotel as beautiful, amazing, spotless and fantastic. The Rose Club bar had a lively atmosphere and seemed to attract a younger crowd.

The Pod Hotel is a modern, trendy hotel with a funky lobby, rooftop lounge, and small but well-organized rooms with iPod docks and flat-screen TVs. It has a garden patio with dining and offers free Wi-Fi, creating a hip, welcoming atmosphere.

The Premier is a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, featuring modern, serene, and comfortable rooms, with spacious bathrooms. It offers a complimentary continental breakfast and evening reception with drinks.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park has a bar and lounge described as having a private club atmosphere and understated elegance and rooms described as cozy and warmer than other hotels. The lobby is relatively small which gives the hotel a personal feel.
The Roosevelt Hotel has a grand lobby with a lively bar and a new rooftop bar called mad46. The lobby's decor gives the hotel a classic dated style, and rooms are on the smaller side.

The Sherry-Netherland is a smaller, intimate hotel with individually decorated, luxurious rooms, offering a "luxury apartment" feel. It is known for its discreet, quiet atmosphere and excellent service, located across from Central Park.
The Shoreham is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with a stylish lobby, a bar, and a 24-hour espresso machine. It has minimalist decor, and is located in midtown near shopping and Central Park.

The St. Regis has a traditional, old-world style with opulent Victorian decor, though some find it a bit old-fashioned. Service is attentive but formal, which may not appeal to those seeking a more casual atmosphere.

The Standard Hotel in the Meatpacking District has cutting-edge design, trendy decor, and a hip bar scene. Rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with city views, plus unique features like peek-a-boo showers.

The Surrey is described as elegant, classy, and modern hip, with newly remodeled rooms featuring unique art pieces and timeless furniture. The lobby is classically modern with marble and one-of-a-kind art.
Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical Harlem townhouse with African art decor. It has apartments with well-equipped kitchens, modern bathrooms, and outdoor terraces.

The Time Hotel is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with red, blue, or yellow themed rooms, a "happening" bar, a lounge, and a restaurant in the heart of Times Square and the Theater District. It features modern decor, flat screen TVs, Bose stereos, and Molton Brown toiletries.
The hotel has art deco design and offers bars with piano music, creating a relaxed and warm atmosphere. It tends to have large events.
This modern Manhattan property has a sleek style with vintage-edge decor and is known for its unique aesthetic, linens, and layouts. However, the lobby may feel cold and impersonal to some guests.

Hotel Thirty Thirty has a hip, minimalist lobby, sleek accommodations, and clean modern or newly renovated bathrooms. The hotel has a modern, trendy presentation but the rooms lack character and are described as neutral or neutral and minimal.

Thompson LES is a modern, trendy hotel with spacious rooms, floor-to-ceiling windows, and great views of the city; it is located in the Lower East Side, close to many restaurants and shops. Some reviewers note a cool, hip vibe, while others mention a minimalist, industrial decor.

The Travel Inn on 42nd street is a budget-friendly hotel near Times Square with clean rooms and free parking; some rooms have microwaves and refrigerators, and there is an outdoor pool. Some rooms face the pool, offering a quieter stay, while others facing 42nd street may experience street noise.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy and stylish hotel with a hip vibe, subdued lighting, and modern decor, located in a convenient area near Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy. It features an open atrium with a popular bar and lounge, and offers amenities such as Bose sound systems, CD players, and sometimes a complimentary goldfish.

The Trump International Hotel has a modern, clean style with spacious rooms, and is described as having a discreet, secure, and residential feel. The hotel is located in Columbus Circle, near Central Park and the Time Warner Center.

The Tudor Hotel is described as nothing fancy and relatively plain with little style, but it has a cute lobby and clean rooms. Some found the hotel charming and obviously renovated, with expansive views and a superb shower.

The Avalon Hotel, now the Vincci Avalon, is a centrally located, updated but dated boutique hotel with spacious rooms, updated bathrooms, and friendly staff. It has large junior and executive suites, with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and opulent entrances.

W The Court is a smaller, stylish hotel with a hip atmosphere, a trendy bar, and a lobby that feels like a living room; decor is chocolate brown, the lighting is low, and the music is modern. The hotel is located in the Murray Hill neighborhood, which has a quieter, less touristy feel.
The W Tuscany is a trendy and modern hotel with a small, intimate lobby that has a relaxed and fun feel. The hotel has a chic, posh, elegant, and minimalist style.

The W Times Square is a trendy and modern hotel with a hopping lobby bar, cascading waterfall entrance, and often features music. The rooms are stylish, clean, and quiet, with comfortable beds and Bliss toiletries.
The W Union Square is a stylish hotel with a hip bar and clean rooms. It has a modern decor, but is sometimes considered too dark.
The Waldorf Towers offers spacious suites with antique furnishings and art deco details, aiming for an old-world charm. Some reviewers noted the hotel's decor might be a bit worn.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quaint boutique hotel with old-world European decor, offering stylish rooms at reasonable prices, especially on weekends. It is located in the quiet financial district, near subway stations, and features a pedestrian alleyway with restaurants behind the hotel.

The Warwick is a historic hotel with spacious, clean rooms, some with city views, and has an old-world ambiance with art deco style suites. It has a bar (Randolph's) with leather couches and a restaurant (Murals on 54th).

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is described as a clean, modern, and updated "boutique" style hotel with a recently renovated lobby in marble. Some reviewers mention stylish decor and flat-screen TVs, and iPod docking stations in the rooms.
The Washington Square Hotel has a charming, historic atmosphere with Art Deco design touches. It is known for its location in Greenwich Village and is described as being quaint and funky.
The Wellington Hotel features an Art Deco lobby with a fireplace and offers rooms with charming but old-fashioned decor. Some reviewers found it to be an old but clean hotel, with a classic NY feel.

The hotel features modern decor and accents, with a studio apartment feel, hardwood floors, and marble showers. Rooms include a Yamaha surround sound projector and a 37-inch LG high-def flat screen TV.

The Wyndham Midtown is described as elegant yet unpretentious, newly renovated with new bedding and carpeting, and smartly styled with functional furnishings and modern decor. It is not very big, having 18 floors with only 6 rooms per floor.

The Wolcott Hotel is a historic hotel with a beautiful lobby, large rooms, and is centrally located near the Empire State Building. The hotel has a pre-war New York ambiance and is decorated in a shabby chic style.

Woogo Central Park Apartments is a no-frills apartment-style accommodation located on the Upper West Side, near the subway and Central Park, with kitchenettes in the rooms. It provides a "live like a local" experience, but without daily maid service or hotel-like amenities.

This hotel is new, stylish, and modern, with contemporary decor, great photographs of the city, and a vibrant atmosphere. It features a cool rooftop bar and a greenhouse-style restaurant with organic food.
